intro: Antimima elevata, commonly known as the tall antimima, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows as an upright shrub with woody stems and opposite leaves. Antimima elevata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
